sub_title: Communications Specialist at Circle Economy | MA Media & Business
summary:
Skilled communication professional with a focus on sustainability, climate change, the energy transition, CSR, and social entrepreneurship. I am experienced in crafting compelling stories and visuals tailor-made for the strategic goals of diverse organisations. Whether it is a social media post, a webpage, a presentation, a report or a video pitch, I can adapt to any format and make it serve your purpose.  

I believe that businesses and non-profits can only be successful if they have a truthful story behind them. A story that resonates with clients and partners, one that we can tell our friends around a bonfire. To create such stories, I get to the bottom of things, I research, check facts, interview people, compose a compelling structure and write, including to a tight deadline. 

My passion for communications and sustainability guided me through the work with diverse international teams united by a common goal: to make the world a better place. Through these experiences, I acquired a profound knowledge of climate change, water and sanitation, gender equality, social entrepreneurship, green energy, Asian and African affairs.    

Do you want to share knowledge or cooperate? Let's connect!

profile_positions.description:
• Write news, press releases, impact stories, and social media content to grow and promote our impact. 
• Plan and execute communications campaigns around report launches, new products and events, including our flagship Circularity Gap Report. 
• Coordinate with research teams, partners and designers to align and fine-tune communications. 
• Track and improve online performance; grow online audience. 
• Support in creating communications strategies, email marketing, and social media management.
profile_positions.title: Communications Specialist

profile_positions.description:
• Managed social media channels (LinkedIn, Twitter, Facebook), growing the number of LinkedIn followers by 30%. 
• Redesigned and optimised the organisation's general slide deck (PowerPoint). 
• Designed engaging and informative one-pagers, visuals, and timelines for fundraising and events (Canva, Adobe Photoshop). 
• Created newsletters (MailChimp) increasing the click rate by 2.4%. 
• Managed and updated the website (WordPress) growing the number of visitors by 8.5%. 
• Created exclusive content for the website, including interviews with partners, funders and grantees. 
• Supported the planning, coordination and promotion of Aqua for All's participation in high-profile events (Amsterdam International Water Week, 9th World Water Forum, Stockholm World Water Week). 
• Analysed online performance, managed and optimised content plans and made recommendations for the improvement of communications strategies (Google Analytics, Meltwater; MS Excel).
profile_positions.title: Communications Intern

profile_positions.description:
• Wrote stories on climate change covering underreported regions and issues. 
• Managed a Twitter account. 
• Recorded podcasts. 
• Wrote newsletters. 
• Produced Instagram live sessions and Instagram stories. 
• Collaborated with a team of international journalists to create complex cross-border stories.

Climate Tracker is an international organisation aimed at training climate and sustainability journalists and supporting their work. It unites those who are passionate about climate goals and relentless in raising awareness about them. Based on my good performance and can-do attitude, I was offered a 3-month extension of the mentorship and included in a list of best female climate reporters.
profile_positions.title: Contributing Writer
